channel.title: Ubuntu: upgrading from 14.04 to 16.04, what to do if do-release-upgrade does not work
channel.description:
Recently I've tried to upgrade Ubuntu from version 14.04 to 16.04 and discovered that for some reason `sudo do-release-upgrade -d` doesn't work as expected:
```text eax@fujitsu:~$ sudo do-release-upgrade -d Checking for a new Ubuntu release No new release found ```
There is little information about this issue in the Internet so I think this howto can really help someone.
First of all, go to System Settings -> Software & Updates -> Updates, make sure `trusty-security` and `trusty-updates` checkboxes are selected. Run:
```bash sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get upgrade -V sudo apt-get dist-upgrade -V sudo reboot ```
After reboot make sure your Ubuntu version is 14.04.4 now:
```text eax@fujitsu:/etc/apt$ cat /etc/lsb-release DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu DISTRIB_RELEASE=14.04 DISTRIB_CODENAME=trusty DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS" eax@fujitsu:/etc/apt$ lsb_release -a No LSB modules are available. Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description: Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS Release: 14.04 Codename: trusty ```
Now edit /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades:
```text eax@fujitsu:~$ cat /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades # Default behavior for the release upgrader.
[DEFAULT] # ... Prompt=lts # <--- CHECK THIS LINE! ```
After all this `sudo do-release-upgrade -d` should upgrade your system to 16.04.1 or newer.
_Supplemental:_ Common issue after updating to 16.04 is a re-enabled guest login. To disable it just execute this command:
```bash sudo sh -c 'printf "[SeatDefaults]\nallow-guest=false\n" > /etc/lightdm/lightdm.conf.d/50-no-guest.conf' ```
